SENT.plain: In surgical treatment was performed of patients after cerebral ischaemic stroke and cerebral ischaemia
The authors applied the surgical technique of indirect anastomosis (EDAS-encephalo-duro-arterio synangiosis)
The Japanese authors described this method first as a treatment for moya-moya disease
The acetazolamid (Diamox) test and clinical symptoms were the main criteria to perform this surgical procedure
All patient with abnormal Diamox test were treated surgically
After 6 months control angiography was performed to visualize a new network of vessels near the main vessel (superficial temporal artery)
